DataElement.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Donor Gender Male Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation donor's gender was male.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Donor Gender
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005_One that contributes something._The assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Donor
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005:One that contributes something.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

Property.preferredDefinition: Gender is the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics of people that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex. As a social construct, gender varies from society to society and can change over time. (Adapted from WHO.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm.  The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both._A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: In zoology, denoting the sex to which those belong that produce spermatozoa; an individual of that sex.:A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
